Utterance: Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How have things been since our last session?
Pretty good! I did some research on social work and looked into some programs.
That’s fantastic! What did you find?
There are a few local programs that sound interesting. Some even offer online classes.
That’s a great start. How do you feel about the options you found?
I’m excited but also a bit overwhelmed by the idea of going back to school.
It’s completely normal to feel that way. What specifically feels overwhelming?
Just the thought of balancing everything—work, kids, and school.
That’s a valid concern. Maybe we can brainstorm ways to create a manageable schedule?
That would help, yeah.
Let’s break it down. How many hours a week do you think you could realistically dedicate to classes?
I could probably do one or two evenings a week.
That sounds doable. What about your kids? How could they fit into this plan?
I could ask my girlfriend to help out on those nights.
That’s a great idea! It’s important to have support. Have you talked to her about this?
Not yet, but I think she’d be on board.
It might be a good conversation to have soon. How do you think she would feel about you pursuing this?
I think she’d be really supportive.
That’s wonderful to hear. It’s important to have that encouragement. Besides the academic aspect, how has your parenting been going?
I’ve been trying to spend more quality time with my kids, and it’s been nice.
That’s great progress! What activities have you been doing together?
We started reading together every night, and they love it.
That sounds lovely! How does it feel to be more present with them?
It feels really rewarding. I feel closer to them.
That’s beautiful. Have you noticed any changes in their behavior since you started being more engaged?
They seem happier and more open with me.
That’s a positive outcome. It’s amazing what a little extra time can do. Are there any challenges you’ve encountered while trying to be more present?
Sometimes I still get stressed and need to remind myself to focus.
That’s understandable. Remember to use the mindfulness techniques we practiced. It’s a skill that takes time to develop.
I’ll keep trying.
And don’t hesitate to take breaks when you need them. It’s important to recharge.
I appreciate that.
Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I’ve been feeling a bit anxious again about job hunting.
Let’s talk about that. Have you applied to any new jobs since we last spoke?
I applied to a couple but haven’t heard back yet.
That can be tough. How are you coping with the waiting?
I’ve been trying to keep busy, but it’s hard not to think about it.
It’s natural to feel that way. Maybe setting aside specific times to look for jobs could help.
That sounds like a good idea.
You could also celebrate small victories, like submitting an application, regardless of the outcome.
I like that approach.
Let’s set that as a goal for the week—dedicate some time to job searching, and celebrate your efforts!
I can do that.
Wonderful! I look forward to hearing about your progress next time. Thank you for sharing today.
Thank you! See you next time!
